body:
Comment 2: 
The -N switch does indeed fix the small program.  However, in my full
program, I now get "panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil
pointer dereference" (which I can eliminate by adding a print() before my f
== nil check).  I saw this error occasionally (along with the others I
mentioned) while trying to isolate the problem earlier.  If you think it
would be helpful, I can try to find minimal code that reproduces the
different sorts of errors.
